constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 88 (Thursday, May 20, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. WASSERMAN SCHULTZ:
H.R. 3455.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article 1, Section 8, clause 3, ``to regulate Commerce
with Foreign Nations, and among the several States, and with
the Indian Tribes;''
Article 1, Section 8, clause 8, ``to promote the Progress
of Science and useful Arts, by securing for limited Times to
Authors and Inventors the exclusive Rights to their
respective Writings and Discoveries,''
[Page H2654]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet.

title: No Stolen Trademarks Honored in America Act
